item.title: Report E-2023080505
item.description:
Report E-2023080505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONVENIENCE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Cargo Tank was was in a construction zone. Shoulder was reduced to 2.5 feet. Left side of vehicle left the pavement and in the drivers attempt of return to the paved surface the trailer "tripped" initiating the a 3/4 rollover. The tractor and cargo tank came to rest on its drivers side. The leakage was from the normal vent for compartment #1. The leakage continue until compartment #1's contents were transloaded during the recovery (approximately 3 hours). The total leakage was 30 gallons which was contained. All contaminated soil was removed and DNR testing has been conducted and submitted.

item.title: Report X-2023080362
item.description:
Report X-2023080362

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SPILAGE AND ITEM WAS TAKEN TO THE DMP FOR INSPECTION. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED NON-REGULATED ITEM LEAKED. RESPONDER ALSO DISCOVERED, UPON OPENING THE BOX, PACKAGE CONTAINED AERESOLS AND WASNT MARKED WITH LIMITED QUANTITY ON THE OUTSIDE. THE RMP WAS NOTIFIED, CALLED THE HAZMATS HELP DESK.

item.title: Report X-2023080360
item.description:
Report X-2023080360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGED AND 2 AEROSOL CANS WERE DISCOVERED INSIDE BOX, DURING CLEAN UP, WITH NO MARKING ON THE OUTSIDE. RESPONDER CALLED HELP DESK, CONFIRMED IT TO BE AN UNDECLARED.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 5 gallon cans of photo chemical (un1993) had poor packaging and had released 2 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
